description: The first nontrivial (k>n+2) palindromic prime in both bases n and n+2.
example: a(3) = 1667 because it is the first prime > 5 which is a palindrome in both base 3 and 5.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k = n + 3}, While[a = IntegerDigits[k, n]; b = IntegerDigits[k, n + 2]; ! PrimeQ[k] || a != Reverse[a] || b != Reverse[b], k++]; k]; Do[ Print[{n, f[n] // Timing}], {n, 2, 10}]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 16 2000
